commitResults.messageTitle: Rename, Greet, Exit - Replace Duke with Spot
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename the starter entry point to Spot and update the build/test setup to
match the new chatbot name (Spot)

- Add Spot main that prints the greeting/logo
- Replaced mentions of Duke with Spot
- Update text UI expected output and test runners to run Spot

commitResults.messageTitle: Echo - Echo user commands and exit if command is bye
commitResults.messageBody: Add an input loop to read commands from java.util.Scanner and echo each line back. Terminate the session when the user enters bye (case-insensitive), then print the farewell message. Also added right-aligned messages for Spot to mimic Chatbot aesthetics

commitResults.messageTitle: Add, List - Store user entered tasks in memory
commitResults.messageBody:
Store user entered tasks and display it on request via the list command.

Ignore empty inputs.

Improved readability with String alignFormat.

commitResults.messageTitle: Mark as Done - Support marking tasks done / undone
commitResults.messageBody: Spot can now mark and unmark added tasks via mark/unmark commands, allowing users to track progress. Edge cases for mark/unmark handled.

commitResults.messageTitle: Spot: Refactor for readability and maintainability
commitResults.messageBody: Spot.java had all it's logic in main(). It started getting hard to understand and work with the code. Refactoring to help improve clarity and make future changes easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: ToDo, Event, Deadline - Added aforementioned task types
commitResults.messageBody:
Spot supports only a single task type with a simple description. Users need to trackcertain types of tasks like  todos (no date), deadlines (due by a date/time), and events (start and end date/time)

Tasks have now been refactored into an abstract Task base with Todo, Deadline,and Event subclasses extending Task. Add-task response now also shows the task count. List and mark/unmark output use the type icon and fulldisplay string for each task

commitResults.messageTitle: A-TextUiTesting via IO redirection
commitResults.messageBody: Spot has no automated checks for its text UI. Manual testing is error prone and scales poorly as more commands are added.Added a text-ui-test setup using IO redirection so that Spot is run with input from a file and output is compared to an expected file. This follows the SE-EDU tutorial on automating text UI testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle Errors: Add error handling and help command
commitResults.messageBody: Spot handles invalid input and unknown commands, and users now have a way to discover available commands.Invalid input leads to unclear behavior or generic messages. A dedicated help command makes the UI easier to use.

commitResults.messageTitle: Delete: Add delete task command
commitResults.messageBody: Users can add, list, and mark/unmark tasks but cannot remove tasks from the list. Users can now remove tasks to keep the list manageable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-7 Save
Merge branch-Level-7: Level-7 Save
Level-8: Dates and Times
commitResults.messageBody: Add date/time handling for deadlines and on command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-Level-8: Level-8: Dates and Times
commitResults.messageBody: Deadline by is stored as a string hence users cannot rely on real datesor times for deadline tracking. Storing dates as java.time types and showing them in a readable format now.

commitResults.messageTitle: Organize Java classes into spot package structure
commitResults.messageBody:
Proper package layout so that the codebase scales and tools can rely on a clear structure

Each class now has the correct package declaration and imports for cross-package references. Build and text-ui-test scripts are updated to use the main class spot.Spot

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge A-Packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Organize Java classes into spot package structure

Proper package layout so that the codebase scales and tools can rely on a clear structure

Each class now has the correct package declaration and imports for cross-package references. Build and text-ui-test scripts are updated to use the main class spot.Spot

commitResults.messageTitle: A-JUnit: Add JUnit tests
commitResults.messageBody: Cover parse/createTask/parseDate, TaskList operations and getDeadlinesOn, Storage load/save round-trips, and Todo/Deadline/Event behavior

commitResults.messageTitle: A-JUnit: Add JUnit tests
commitResults.messageBody: Cover parse/createTask/parseDate, TaskList operations and getDeadlinesOn, Storage load/save round-trips, and Todo/Deadline/Event behavior

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge A-JavaDoc, A-CodingStandard, Level-9, A-Cheer
Add Checkstyle and fix style violations
commitResults.messageBody:
Project does not enforce the SE-EDU Java coding standard, making styleregressions easy to miss.

Let's enable Gradle Checkstyle with the SE-EDU ruleset and update code tocomply with it:
- Add Checkstyle plugin and config under config/checkstyle/
- Fix import grouping/order and remove star static imports in tests
- Wrap long lines and fix whitespace issues

Checked with: gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest, gradlew test

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Checkstyle and fix style violations
commitResults.messageBody:
Project does not enforce the SE-EDU Java coding standard, making styleregressions easy to miss.

Let's enable Gradle Checkstyle with the SE-EDU ruleset and update code tocomply with it:
>> - Add Checkstyle plugin and config under config/checkstyle/
>> - Fix import grouping/order and remove star static imports in tests
>> - Wrap long lines and fix whitespace issues

Checked with: gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest, gradlew test

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-10:GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Spot has only a text-based CLI. A graphical interface improves usabilityand aligns the project with the JavaFX tutorial structure.

Let's add a JavaFX GUI:* Introduce a separate Launcher class as the JavaFX entry point and keep Spot as the CLI entry point.* Add Main, DialogBox and FXML/resources for the GUI; run via  spot.Launcher or ./gradlew run.* Use DaUser.png and DaSpot.png in src/main/resources/images/ for  user and Spot avatars in dialog boxes (placeholders if missing).* Retain all existing behavior; CLI still runs via spot.Spot with the  same commands and data file (data/spot.txt).

README and build.gradle are updated for JDK 21 and GUI run instructions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ui: Use plain formatting for GUI output
commitResults.messageBody:
When Ui writes to an Appendable (GUI), it reuses the same bordered,right-aligned layout as the CLI. That produces long dashed separatorlines in the chat and fixed-width help text that breaks when thelabel wraps, splitting explanations across lines.

Introduce a GUI mode (output != null): skip border lines andright-alignment, and format help as one line per command(command - description) so each pair stays together when wrapped.Apply the same plain formatting to welcome, farewell, list, find,deadlines, task confirmations, errors, and cheer so all Spotreplies in the GUI are readable without CLI artifacts.

CLI behavior is unchanged: when output is System.out, the existingbordered layout is still used.

commitResults.messageTitle: DialogBox: Shrink avatars and show them as circles
commitResults.messageBody:
Avatar images in chat boxes were 100100 and rectangular, so theydominated the layout and looked out of place.

Reduce avatar size to 4848 and clip the ImageView with a Circle souser and Spot pictures appear as circular profile images. UsesetPreserveRatio(true) so the image is scaled without distortion before clipping.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Add chat bubbles and spacing for dialog messages
commitResults.messageBody:
Dialog messages are plain labels with no visual container and littlespace between text and avatar or between messages, so the chat feelscramped and flat.

Style the message text as rounded rectangles (bubbles) with padding:light gray for the user and light blue for Spot so each side iseasy to tell apart. Add spacing between the bubble and the avatarinside each row, and padding and vertical spacing in the dialogcontainer so messages are clearly separated.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Style window, Spot bubble, and add an empty-state hint
commitResults.messageBody:
The main window has no background styling, the input blends into the chat, Spots bubble color is generic, and new users get no prompt when the chat is empty.

Set a consistent light gray background (#f0f0f0) on the main pane andmake the scroll area transparent so it matches. Give the inputfield a white background and a light top border so it is clearlyseparate from the chat. Change Spots bubble to blue (#03a2e9) withwhite text for a clearer brand look. Add a short hint above theinputType a command or say helpwhen there are no (or onlywelcome) messages, and hide it after the first user message so thechat stays uncluttered once in use.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Add Spot header and remove Spot avatar from chat bubbles
commitResults.messageBody:
The chat has no fixed contact area, and Spots image appears next to every Spot message, so it feels repetitive.

Add a fixed top header that stays visible when scrolling, with acircular Spot avatar and the label Spot the Dog, and give thescrollable area a clear top bound. Remove the Spot avatar from chatbubbles so DaSpot.png is shown only in the header; Spots repliesremain blue bubbles on the right with no avatar. User messages stillshow DaUser.png next to the gray bubble.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'Level-10' into master
commitResults.messageBody: Integrate Level-10: JavaFX GUI for Spot (Launcher, Main, DialogBox),chat bubbles, header with Spot avatar, and GUI-friendly UI output

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Omit Spot: prefix from Spot's chat messages
commitResults.messageBody:
In the GUI, the header already shows Spot the Dog, so repeating Spot: at the start of each reply is redundant.

- Use message text without Spot: everywhere

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList.findTasks() and Parser handling of the find command had no unit tests
commitResults.messageBody:
Add tests so search and find-parsing behaviour is covered and regressions are caught.

- TaskListTest: findTasks_withMatchingKeyword_returnsMatchingTasks
  (positive, incl. case-insensitive match), findTasks_nullEmptyOrNoMatch_
  returnsEmptyList (negative).
- ParserTest: parse_findWithKeyword_returnsFindWithArgument (positive),
  parse_findWithNoKeyword_returnsEmptyArgument (negative).
Tests follow existing style and use brief comments to state each tests purpose.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Assertions: Add assert statements to document code assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Assumptions at key points in the code are not documented or checked.

Adding Java assert makes preconditions and
invariants explicit and enforces them when the JVM is run with -ea.

- Task layer: non-null description, deadline by, event from/to
- TaskList: non-null task in add(); index in range for get/remove
- Parser/ParsedCommand: non-null input and parsed command
- Storage: non-null path and task list; valid line part counts when parsing
- Spot: non-empty trimmed input in runOneCommand; valid task index after
  range check in mark/delete; non-empty quotes before random pick
- Ui: non-null scanner and task; positive border width; HELP_COMMANDS rows
  have [command, description]; non-null queried date in showDeadlinesOn

Assertions are disabled by default; enable with -ea for development or
testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-CodeQuality: Refactor code for Code Quality standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Apply CS2103DE Code Quality guidelines across the codebase to improve
readability and maintainability.

- Ui: Remove dead commented LOGO code; name magic numbers in help table
  (HELP_CMD_WIDTH, HELP_COLUMN_GAP); extract printTaskListBlock() so
  showList, showMatchingTasks, and showDeadlinesOn share one path.
- Spot: Extract parseAndValidateTaskIndex() so mark/delete share
  parsing and validation (DRY, guard clauses).
- Storage: Split on STORAGE_DELIMITER_REGEX (Pattern.quote) instead of
  inline regex.
- Parser, CheerQuotes: Document intentionally empty catch blocks.
- TaskList: Flatten nested if in getDeadlinesOn to a single condition.
- DialogBox: Replace magic numbers with MAX_TEXT_WIDTH and
  AVATAR_TEXT_SPACING.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Stream: Use Java Streams in TaskList, Storage, Ui and CheerQuotes
commitResults.messageBody:
List iteration and filtering were done with manual for loops and
mutable accumulators. Refactoring to Streams makes the intent
clearer and aligns with idiomatic Java.

- TaskList: findTasks and getDeadlinesOn use stream().filter().toList()
- Storage: load() parses lines via map/filter; save() maps tasks to lines
- Ui: showList, showMatchingTasks, showDeadlinesOn use IntStream.range;
  showHelp uses Arrays.stream(HELP_COMMANDS).forEach
- CheerQuotes: use .toList() and return List.of() for empty cases

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge Master into branch-A-CodeQuality
Merge Master into branch-A-Streams
Merge master into branch-A-Streams
Style: align switch/case, add Javadoc param docs, and improve naming
commitResults.messageBody:
Align case indentation with switch in runCommandLoop, createTask, and getAddTaskErrorMessage as per CS2103DE guidelines

Add Javadoc (including @param descriptions) for runCommandLoop and handleOnCommand.

Replace generic names with meaningful names (e.g., numberFormatException, parseException, dateTimeString)

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: More OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Extract closely related code into dedicated classes to improve code organization and maintainability

Spot.java now acts as a lightweight orchestrator that coordinates between the extracted components.
All functionality remains unchanged and text-ui tests pass without modification.
